intro: Morawetzia variicolor, commonly known as the rainbow flower, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Andean region of South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, multicolored bracts that range from red to orange and yellow, creating a visually stunning display. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, contrasting with the showy foliage. Morawetzia variicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in botanical gardens and as a rare horticultural specimen.
